meanings.definition: To chase or follow someone or something in order to catch or overtake them.
meanings.sent1: The cheetah tried to outpursue the gazelle in the race.
meanings.sent2: The police officer had to outpursue the thief to catch him.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy decided to outpursue its own tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The determined athlete aimed to outpursue the current record in the upcoming competition.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to outpursue the suspect through the crowded streets.

meanings.definition: To surpass or exceed in pursuit or chase.
meanings.sent1: In the marathon, she managed to outpursue her previous best time.
meanings.sent2: The experienced hunter knew how to outpursue the elusive prey in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The ambitious student wanted to outpursue all her classmates in the academic competition.
meanings.sent4: The determined swimmer aimed to outpursue the competition in the final lap.
meanings.sent5: The skilled archer could outpursue any challenger in accuracy and precision.
